Description: Shoulder sherd (mended from four fragments, including 1888,0601.460.c and 499.b) of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery dinos with four-reeded handle; interior reserved; exterior white slipped: glazed black around handle which has horizontal stripes across reeds; key maeander strips to sides and below; vertical dotted square strips left and right; to left, on shoulder, part of corner roundel; below, on upper body, frieze og goats to right (body, upper hindlegs and part of forelegs remaining of one goat and tail of second goat); pendant triangle and rosette as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Group of the Aphrodite Bowl
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1888,0601.460.c and 1888,0601.499.b and may belong to the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.443. Although Lemos does not specifically classify this sherd in the Group of Late Wild Goat sherds from Rizari, she does include one of the joining sherds (1888,0601.460.c) in this group because of its milky white slip which is found on all examples from this group and because of the debased character of the patterns and filling ornament (Lemos 1991, 77). Williams notes that Chian Wild Goat Style dinoi sherds are often mistaken for oinochoai because of the lack of slip on the interior surface.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 77, p. 246, no. 289)
Williams 2006a / The Chian Pottery from Naukratis (p.128-9, fig.7, p. 132 note 29)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0025) (phase 2)
